dantapura：dantapura（na）
ဒန္တပုရ（န）
[danta+pura]
[ဒန္တ+ပုရ]

Dantapura：Capital of the Kālinga country，reigned over by King Sattabhu，contemporary with Renu （D.ii.235f）．

Other kings mentioned are Nālikīra （J.v.144） and Karandu （J.iii.376ff）．

The city is mentioned also in the Kurudhamma Jātaka （Also DhA.iv.89； see also Mtu.iii.361，364），theCullakālinga Jātaka，and theKālingabodhi Jātaka．

The left eye-tooth of the Buddha was in Dantapura until taken to Ceylon by Dantākumāra．It had been handed over by Khema Thera （Dāthavamsa ii.52，57； for its identification see CAGI.593） to Brahmadatta，king of Dantapura.

dantapura：ဒန္တပုရ（န）
[ဒန္တ+ပုရ]
ဒန္တပုရမြို့။ ရန်သူကို-ဆုံးမ-ယဉ်ကျေးစေ-ရာမြို့။ ဒန္တပုရနဂရ-လည်းကြည့်။ မူရင်းကြည့်ပါ။
